content.description:
Climb the face and arête through a couple overhangs. Really fun climb, and fairly pumpy if you hang around thinking about the crux for too long, which comes at mid-height. Tightly bolted, save a run-out section of easy climbing up to a ledge.

Rap from the anchors that are around the corner to the right, or you can walk off by climbing up a cracked boulder and down a trail to the right.

Blocky arête with a series of small overhangs. 
Bolts.

climbs.name: Levis
climbs.fa: Chris Lawrence, Philip Stone, John Put, Fred Put 1992, Donna Pakosz, Chris Barner, Paul Rydeen, Alanna Theoret

content.description:
Amazing route. The start was a little tricky for gear but once you hit the first ledge there's plenty of options in a number of sizes and this stays true for most of the route. The 2 roof sections are incredible and the finishing crack to top out is just really good fun.



If you're in the area, it's not hard to find the prominent arete for the Crow's Nest and the route starts a couple if meters to the left of the arete in a corner. 

1 piton on route and 2 bolt anchor. Rap anchors nearby on Azen Wave.
Some high quality moderate sport and trad routes live here.
